title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #1049: Irrationality of Divisor Sums**

For rational t > 1, is ∑_{n≥1} 1/(t^n - 1) irrational?

This equals ∑ τ(n)/t^n where τ is the divisor function.

**Status**: OPEN

**Partial**: YES for integer t ≥ 2 (Erdős 1948).

title: Divisor Function
content:
**tau n**: τ(n) = |{d : d divides n}|.

The number of positive divisors of n.

τ(6) = 4 since 1, 2, 3, 6 divide 6.

title: τ(1) = 1
content:
**tau_one**: τ(1) = 1.

The only divisor of 1 is 1 itself.

title: τ of Prime
content:
**tau_prime**: τ(p) = 2 for prime p.

Primes have exactly two divisors: 1 and p.

title: τ of Prime Power
content:
**tau_prime_pow**: τ(p^k) = k + 1.

Divisors of p^k are 1, p, p², ..., p^k.

title: Multiplicativity
content:
**tau_multiplicative**: τ(mn) = τ(m)τ(n) for coprime m, n.

The divisor function is multiplicative.

This is key for computing τ via prime factorization.

title: Series S(t)
content:
**S t**: S(t) = ∑_{n≥1} 1/(t^n - 1).

The main series of the problem.

Converges for t > 1.

title: Divisor Series D(t)
content:
**D t**: D(t) = ∑_{n≥1} τ(n)/t^n.

The divisor-weighted exponential series.

This equals S(t) by the classical identity.

title: S Convergence
content:
**S_summable**: S(t) converges for t > 1.

Since t^n - 1 ~ t^n for large n, terms decay like 1/t^n.

title: Classical Identity
content:
**S_eq_D**: ∑ 1/(t^n - 1) = ∑ τ(n)/t^n.

Proof: τ(n) = Σ_{d|n} 1, so
∑ τ(n)/t^n = ∑_d ∑_m 1/t^{dm} = ∑_d 1/(t^d - 1).

A fundamental identity connecting the two series.

title: Double Sum
content:
**double_sum_identity**: ∑_{d,m≥1} 1/t^{dm} = ∑_{n≥1} τ(n)/t^n.

Counting divisor pairs (d, m) with dm = n gives τ(n) terms.

title: Geometric Series
content:
**geometric_divisor**: ∑_{m≥1} 1/t^{dm} = 1/(t^d - 1).

This is a geometric series with ratio 1/t^d.

Key step in proving the identity.

title: Erdős's Theorem
content:
**erdos_integer_irrational (1948)**: S(t) is irrational for integer t ≥ 2.

The main partial result towards the full conjecture.

Published in the Journal of the Indian Mathematical Society.

title: S(2) Irrational
content:
**S_at_2_irrational**: S(2) is irrational.

Immediate from Erdős's theorem with t = 2.

title: Chowla's Conjecture
content:
**ChowlaConjecture**: S(t) is irrational for ALL rational t > 1.

Generalizes Erdős's result from integers to all rationals.

Status: OPEN.

title: Chowla for Integers
content:
**chowla_for_integers**: Chowla's conjecture holds for integer t ≥ 2.

This is precisely Erdős's 1948 result.

title: S(2) Approximation
content:
**S_at_2_approx**: S(2) ≈ 1.606695...

1.606 < S(2) < 1.607.

This is the Erdős-Borwein constant.

title: Erdős-Borwein Constant
content:
**erdosBorweinConstant**: The value S(2) ≈ 1.606695...

Named after Erdős and Peter Borwein who studied its properties.

title: S(3) Irrational
content:
**S_at_3_irrational**: S(3) = ∑ 1/(3^n - 1) is irrational.

Another instance of Erdős's theorem.

title: Limit at 1
content:
**S_tendsto_infinity**: S(t) → +∞ as t → 1⁺.

The series diverges as we approach the boundary.

title: Limit at Infinity
content:
**S_tendsto_zero**: S(t) → 0 as t → +∞.

All terms vanish as t grows.

title: Transcendental Conjecture
content:
**TranscendentalConjecture**: S(t) is transcendental for algebraic t > 1.

Stronger than irrationality: not just ∉ ℚ but not algebraic.

title: Transcendental Implies Chowla
content:
**transcendental_implies_chowla**: If S(t) is transcendental for algebraic t, then Chowla's conjecture holds.

Transcendental numbers are irrational.

title: Lambert Series
content:
**isLambertSeries**: ∑ a_n q^n/(1 - q^n).

A classical type of generating function.

S(t) is a Lambert series with a_n = 1 and q = 1/t.

title: S as Lambert
content:
**S_as_lambert**: S(t) = ∑_{n≥1} (1/t)^n/(1 - (1/t)^n).

Recasting S(t) as a Lambert series with q = 1/t.

title: Bounds on S
content:
**S_bounds**: 1/(t-1) ≤ S(t) ≤ t/(t-1)².

Upper and lower bounds for the series.

Useful for numerical approximation.

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_1049_partial**: For integer t ≥ 2, S(t) is irrational.

This is Erdős's 1948 theorem, the main known result.

The full Chowla conjecture for rationals remains OPEN.

title: Final Answer
content:
**erdos_1049_answer**: "OPEN: Irrational for integer t ≥ 2 (Erdős). Chowla's conjecture unresolved."

**erdos_1049_status**: "OPEN - Chowla's conjecture unresolved"

title: Final Theorem
content:
**erdos_1049**: ∀ integer t ≥ 2, S(t) is irrational.

The complete statement of Erdős's partial resolution.
